TopicTitle: Need help - game crashes in dual monitor setup

Articles.Content:
Today I ran my system on dual-screen the first time. I seems that KSP doesn't quite like that.

I did a clean reinstall but the game still chrashes.

My Setup:

Win 8.1 64bit

Intel core I7-4790 @ 3.60GHz

16 gb Ram

AMD R9 280x and an integrated Intel 4000HD Chip

The screens:

Dell U2414H 24" & HP w1907v 17"

The new Dell screen obiously is my primary the HP the secondary.

I don't run the game on both but want to run it on the Dell with the HP showing Telemachus data.

The game is loading and can choose a savegame, but on the loading screen or the space center screen the game freezes and stops working. Sometimes it just crashes, sometimes there is an erreor message:

"Error - can not set requested resolution 1980 * 1080. Trying lower resolution.

Can not set requested lower resolution. Trying lower resolution.

Etc. " or something like that.

Then it crashes.

I already rebooted after installing the new screen. I updated the drivers of the screens and the R9. I updated Catalyst Control Center. Nothing helped.

I tried to unplug the secondary screen. Still crashed.

After that i thought KSP might use the integrated Intel Graphics so I deactivated it, resulting in the second screen getting no signal but the game still crashes.

Help?

Edit: I also tried to run the game in windowed mode and -popupscreen mode. Nothing.

Oh and KSP is not the only affected game. Heartstone also crashes. Haven't tried anything else yet.

Edited January 30, 2015 by Baenki

What's your desktop resolution? Unity sometimes freaks out if you ask it to run at a higher resolution than your desktop resolution.

You mentioned you've tried the full-window mode -- did you just mistype the command option here? it's -popupwindow (just to be sure).

Might also be worth trying running KSP with the -adapter N flag, N being either 0 or 1 (try both). It may also be worth seeing if you can disable AMD's Raptr application for KSP, if you have it installed (I've noticed it can sometimes cause issues like this for no apparent reason).

Thank you so much. -adapter 1 actually did it.

+rep
